definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: This week’s demonstration was designed to drum up interest in the platform.
sentences.chinese: 本周的演示是为了招徕对这个平台的关注。

sentences.english: The advertisements for the concert fetched in large crowds.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会的广告招徕了大量听众。

sentences.english: Several men stood outside the ground, touting for the various sideshows.
sentences.chinese: 好几个人站在场外，为正在演出的各类杂耍招徕观众。

sentences.english: But when it is also chaotic, it causes pain and suffering and calls for attention.
sentences.chinese: 只有当运作失序时，它才引发痛苦并招徕注视。

sentences.english: Moreover, Ames is a bring-your-own-voters affair.
sentences.chinese: 而且，艾姆斯市是招徕自己支持者投票的地方。

sentences.english: Come to know the consequences of rebellion will bring severe judgment from God.
sentences.chinese: 认识顽梗背逆的结果，必定招徕神严厉的审判。

sentences.english: It is the eye-catcher that visitors use to get to the shop.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个非常吸引人的结构，它能招徕顾客。

definition: to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location
businessmen and travelers/traveling merchant/(Tw) business hotel
to collect money/to raise funds (for charity)
to compete/to fight for/to rush to purchase
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
to recruit surrendered enemy and deserters (idiom); to gather together a gang of villains
to win the support of/to get over to one's side/to keep control of
